featured.text: They can use their sense of vision and smell to tell the difference between people who pose a threat and those who do not.
Recent experiments with this device showed that 80% of the participants were fooled by the smell.
Left ______ for years, the deserted house was filled with a thick coating of dust and a smell of old damp wood.
Seeing a potential threat without its smell means that risk is low.

When the elephants detected the smell of clothing worn by a Maasai man, they moved away from the smell faster and took longer to relax than when they detected the smells of either clothing worn by Kamba men or clothing that had not been worn at all.

other.text: What is the main idea of this passage? (A) Elephants use sight and smell to detect danger.
How did the elephants react to smell in the study?
Smelling a potential danger means that a threat is nearby and the best thing to do is run away and hide.
Rather than running away as they did with the smell, the elephants acted aggressively toward the red clothing.

The feel of a book, the smell, the weight, and the knowledge that a particular book might be more than a hundred years old—all these highlight the importance of preserving the physical book as a complement to technology.
They needed time to relax when smelling something unfamiliar.
They attacked a man with the smell of new clothing.
the sweet smell from the bakery, so I walked in and bought a fresh loaf of bread.
The researchers believe that the elephants’ emotional reactions are due to their different interpretations of the smells and the sights.

definition.en_def: The sensation produced by the stimulation of the olfactory receptors in the nose.
definition.example: The smell of fresh bread filled the kitchen.
